intro: Ampelocissus trichoclada, commonly known as the African ivy, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and dense foliage. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while the flowers are small and greenish-white. It produces small, fleshy berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. This plant is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in various conditions.
